content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 3 in the provided graph is:

6 -> 7 -> 4

Note that the path is shortest because it avoids the intermediate nodes 2 and 5. If you change the destination node to be the previous point (i.e., node 3), the shortest path would be:

6 -> 7

In this case, the new shortest path is the same as the original shortest path minus the last point (i.e., 6 -> 7).

The graph: {'nodes': [0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7], 'edges': [[0, 2], [1, 2], [2, 4], [2, 7], [3, 7], [4, 5], [6, 7]]} The start node: 6 The destination:  7

In this case, the new shortest path is the same as the original shortest path minus the last point (i.e., 6

The shortest path from node 6 to node 7 in the provided graph is:

6 -> 7

This is because there is only one edge directly connecting nodes 6 and 7. No intermediate nodes are required to reach the target point. Therefore, the shortest path is simply the start node (6) followed by the target node (7).
